title: Linux disable Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux disable command and learn how to disable services using practical examples. Understand the purpose and verify the disabled status of services.

meta.title: Linux disable Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux disable command and learn how to disable services using practical examples. Understand the purpose and verify the disabled status of services.
meta.keywords: Linux, disable, service, command, utilities, system administration

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the disable Command

verify.name: Verify the apache2 service is disabled
verify.hint: The apache2 service should be disabled. You can verify this by running `systemctl is-enabled apache2` and checking if the output contains 'disabled'.

steps.title: Disable a Service Using the disable Command

verify.name: Verify the nginx service is disabled
verify.hint: The nginx service should be disabled. You can verify this by running `systemctl is-enabled nginx` and checking if the output contains 'disabled'.

verify.name: Verify the nginx service is disabled
verify.hint: The nginx service should be disabled. You can verify this by running `systemctl is-enabled nginx` and checking if the output contains 'disabled'.
